column4: if you modprobe something, will it automatically load when you reboot?
no
how do you get them to load automatically?  some config file?
/etc/modules
have you tried a debian-version of the wlan-ng howto?
that worked for me a few years back when I was using it
and I imagine that it might still work on ubuntu
I tried a hoary one and it didn't work - the prism2_cs module doesn't do anything
pcmcia is good in lsmod though
is prism2_cs the wlan-ng module?
actually, I remember that being buggered
i guess so - i don't know what else is
make sure your pcmcia net.config hint points at the right driver
I think "first one wins"
I really hated wlan-ng ;)
what would be the alternative for prism2 cards?
duno, it's been a while since I used something that didn't work with stock drivers. lucky I guess.
just my usb adaptors still need wlan-ng and those are in the closet ;)
so where is this pcmcia net.config located??
found it. look in /etc/pcmcia/config and see if the right driver is being loaded for your card
I vagely recall that being a problem at one point
you might scrape some debugging hints from /var/log/* too
but is has been a long time since I had to troubleshoot cardctrl
